frame.name: Revenge
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns the infliction of punishment in return for a wrong suffered. An <fen>Avenger</fen> performs a <fen>Punishment</fen> on a <fen>Offender</fen> as a consequence of an earlier action by the <fen>Offender</fen>, the <fen>Injury</fen>. The <fen>Avenger</fen> inflicting the<fen>Punishment</fen> need not be the same as the <fen>Injured_Party</fen> who suffered the <fen>Injury</fen>, but the <fen>Avenger</fen> does have to share the judgment that the <fen>Offender</fen>'s action was wrong. The judgment that the <fen>Offender</fen> had inflicted an <fen>Injury</fen> is made without regard to the law.
<ex>(1) <fex name="Avenger">They</fex> took <t>revenge</t> <fex name="Injury">for the deaths of two loyalist prisoners</fex>.</ex> <ex>(2) <fex name="Avenger">Lachlan</fex> went out to <t>avenge</t> <fex name="Injured_Party">them</fex>.</ex> <ex>(3) The next day, the Roman forces took <t>revenge</t> <fex name="Offender">on their enemies.</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Avenger
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Avenger</fen> exacts revenge from the <fen>Offender</fen> for the <fen>Injury</fen>.
<ex> <fex name="Avenger">We</fex> want to <t>avenge</t> her. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which an event occurs. <ex>Marie took <fex name="Degree">terrible</fex> <t>revenge</t> on Trevor.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Depictive</fen> identifies a phrase describing the actor of an action.</def-root>

FE.name: Offender
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Offender</fen> has committed the earlier <fen>Injury</fen> for which the <fen>Avenger</fen> seeks revenge.
<ex>Jo had the affair as a kind of <t>revenge</t> <fex name="Offender">against Pat</fex>.</ex> <ex>Marie took terrible <t>revenge</t> <fex name="Offender">on Trevor</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> with which the revenge is performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>This frame element refers to the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Avenger</fen> exacts their revenge from the <fen>Offender</fen>.
<ex>They took <fex name="Manner">brutal</fex> <t>revenge</t> on the criminal.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Punishment
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Avenger</fen> carries out a <fen>Punishment</fen> in order to exact revenge on the <fen>Offender</fen>.
<ex>The team took <t>revenge</t> <fex name="Punishment">with a resounding victory</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the revenge occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the revenge is performed. </def-root>

FE.name: Injury
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Injury</fen> is the injurious action committed by the <fen>Offender</fen> against the <fen>Injured_Party</fen>. This Frame Element need not always be realized, although it is conceptually necessary.
<ex>The team sought <t>revenge</t> <fex name="Injury">for their 4-1 defeat last month</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of inflicting punishment for a wrong suffered.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the revenge occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Injured_party
FE.definition:
<def-root>This frame element identifies the constituent that encodes who or what suffered the <fen>Injury</fen> at the hands of the <fen>Offender</fen>. Sometimes, an abstract concept such a person's honour or their blood is presented as the element that has suffered the <fen>Injury</fen>. These also constitute instances of <fen>Injured_party</fen>
<ex>Sam's brothers <t>avenged</t> <fex name="Injured_party">him</fex>.</ex> <ex>We will decide later how to <t>avenge</t> <fex name="Injured_party">the blood of the fallen</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time that the <fen>Avenger</fen> seeks revenge for the <fen>Injury</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: avenge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: inflict harm on somebody in return for an injury or wrong suffered

lexUnit.name: avenger.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who takes vengeance for some wrong suffered on their own or somebody else's behalf

lexUnit.name: vengeance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: punishment inflicted in retaliation for an injury or offense

lexUnit.name: retaliate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make an attack or assault in return for a similar attack.

lexUnit.name: revenge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: inflict revenge for an injury or wrong done to oneself or somebody else

lexUnit.name: revenge.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: retaliation for an injury or wrong.

lexUnit.name: vengeful.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: seeking to harm someone in return for a perceived injury.

lexUnit.name: vindictive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having or showing a strong or unreasoning desire for revenge

lexUnit.name: retribution.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: punishment inflicted in the spirit of moral outrage or personal vengeance

lexUnit.name: retaliation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an attack or assault in return for a similar attack.

lexUnit.name: revenger.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: somebody seeking to exact revenge

lexUnit.name: get even.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: inflict on another person similar harm or injury to what they inflicted on you previously

lexUnit.name: retributory.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: of or relating to retribution

lexUnit.name: sanction.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: measures taken by a state to coerce another to conform to an international agreement or norms of conduct.
